intro: Strobilanthes parabolica, commonly known as the "Christmas flower," is a herbaceous plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble a Christmas tree, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its vibrant purple and pink bracts that enclose the small, tubular flowers. It typically blooms during the winter season, making it a unique and sought-after ornamental plant. Due to its ecological and horticultural significance, it is also considered a conservation priority in its native habitat.
